lexUnit.name: blouse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's upper garment resembling a shirt

sentence.text: She was wearing a fashionable knee-length straight skirt , a silk blouse in a vivid jade-green , and slender-heeled shoes .
She changed her mind and put on her black velvet skirt and a fairly new satin blouse in kingfisher-blue that matched her eyes .
Meg Dennison was in a long black skirt and a blue patterned silk blouse with a bow at the neck .
She wore a smart blue skirt , and her new navy three-quarter-length coat over her shoulders ; a white lacy blouse with a navy-blue trimming .
His softened looks hardened , but she evaded his hands and went headlong down the stairs , stopping only momentarily to brush the straw from her trousers and fasten her blouse with shaking fingers .
Becky stopped buttoning up her blouse .
I helped her prepare for the date , pressing her nicest blouse , lending her my best necklace and polishing her shoes .
He stared at the two assistants in their smart white blouses and green aprons .
She settled on a plain pleated skirt in burgundy wool , a cream blouse and a lightweight cashmere sweater .
He glanced at her blue satin blouse .
She was dressed in an expensive pair of sharkskin trousers , a silk blouse and sandals .
He lifted out a white silk blouse trimmed with fine lace , felt the fabric and handed it to the sales assistant who stood behind them .
Affectionately , Ryan twisted the drawstring of her new embroidered blouse around his fingers .
By 1985 this businesslike severity has given way to a white pie-frill collared blouse from Laura Ashley .
He groaned and drew her closer , one hand around her waist , while the other separated her blouse from the waistband of her skirt .
The strapless dress had n't needed one , of course , and in her haste to change , she had dived into this roomy blouse without even thinking of it .
He took great care not to touch her or allow his grubby clothes to come into contact with her beautiful skirt and creamy-white blouse .
Benny had looked at the cream-coloured blouses and soft pink angora sweaters .
She had a white blouse on , and a severe grey skirt that reached halfway down her calves .
The burgundy skirt was smeared with grime and buttons were missing from her gaping blouse .
He noticed that she had one button of her blouse more than usual undone .
The heather and heath tones of the jacket complement the honey-coloured suede waistcoat and the white tie neck blouse adds a touch of elegance .
There they rested before continuing in a slow trickle of delicious sensation to the neck of her blouse .
She sold him something simple , one skirt of navy blue , one which she said was autumn brown , and two white blouses .
There is a blouse of midnight blue with a diamond flower that sat on my breast when I wore it .
Sunnie Mann was dressed in an opaque white blouse and a red and black skirt .
At 3.05pm she appeared barefoot , dressed in jeans and a cotton blouse on the doorstep to say she was going to post some letters .
I was ready and dressed in my white blouse , grey pinafore dress , grey tights my new black shoes and green cardigan .
When she returned , some twenty minutes later , she was wearing a lilac pintucked pinafore dress over a flower-sprigged blouse with a white collar .
Impatiently she pulled off the blouse and unhooked the brassiere , throwing them out of sight into the pool house .
Pat pulled the white blouse out of the wrapper and held it to her cheek , rubbing the soft material against her skin .
Finally she pulled out a dark blue blouse with a matching skirt .
She unbuttoned her blouse .
She stood by the foot of the bed and unbuttoned her blouse .
Reluctantly , Jeanne undid her blouse , and slipped it from her slim white shoulders .
She had begun to help , undoing a button of her blouse , but his hands had gone to hers .
Germaine Meyer was wearing a sky-blue blouse that summer afternoon and Modigliani was immediately arrested by her colouring , a blend of rose and white , and asked her eagerly if he could paint her .
She was wearing a short-sleeved blouse that left her arms bare to the elbow .
She wore a neat flowered blouse and light coloured skirt underneath her blue regulation prison smock ; sensible shoes ; small gold earrings and bright pink lipstick .
She pointed at Mother Joan , who was wearing a stylish grey silk blouse and long dark grey skirt , with a black-banded straw boater .
I 'm glad I was wearing my mother 's red blouse .
The French kiss went on forever , and as the persistent tongue scoured the back of her throat , so she became aware of nimble fingers slipping her blouse from her shoulders and unfastening her bra .
He was led to his seat by a young woman dressed in a long green velvet skirt and a high-necked , white lace blouse with leg-of-mutton sleeves .
She was wearing a black , ankle-length skirt and a white blouse which was buttoned up to her throat .
The new blouse was pink and frilly , quite unlike anything the children had seen her wear before , and she had combed her hair and put lipstick on .
Anna had taken off her blouse and was waiting for Liz to notice her shoulder .
Her skirt was short , above slim , silk-stockinged legs , and her peach-coloured rayon blouse was open almost indecently low upon her well-formed bosom .
She still had on the revealing silk blouse she had worn in the show , with stage jewellery sparkling at her throat and breast .
The blouse has short dolman sleeves , a fly front fastening and a mock pocket flap on the left breast .
When it was all over I had on a wet blouse , but Shirnette had one on too .
